content:
• Thursday, April 5, 2012
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (COO +3.9%) finished the day strong after William Blair pounds the table...

    Cooper Companies (COO +3.9%) finished the day strong after William Blair pounds the table calling on investors to buy. The firm says that after meeting with management, it views the stock as highly compelling at current levels, and its top pick among all the companies it covers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • BMY

    Amylin (AMLN +1%) spiked a little near the close following a report Bristol-Myers (NYSE:BMY) is...

    Amylin (AMLN +1%) spiked a little near the close following a report Bristol-Myers (NYSE:BMY) is still eying the drugmaker, which reportedly turned down a $22/share offer earlier this year. Amylin, which is under pressure from Carl Icahn to consider a sale, closed at $24.12.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDFC

    WD-40 Company (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $86M (+9% Y/Y) beats by...

    WD-40 Company (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $86M (+9% Y/Y) beats by $0.7M. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • GFIG

    GFI Group (GFIG +6.9%) is solidly in the green today after being upgraded to Outperform on...

    GFI Group (GFIG +6.9%) is solidly in the green today after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation earlier at Raymond James. The firm cites recent restructuring efforts and potential synergies from previous acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • FHC

    Pushing ahead on plans to slim down, FelCor Lodging Trust (FHC +17.5%) agrees to sell six hotels...

    Pushing ahead on plans to slim down, FelCor Lodging Trust (FHC +17.5%) agrees to sell six hotels for $103M to an undisclosed buyer. The REIT, which has prioritized stripping itself of "non-strategic" properties, will use proceeds to reduce debt and pay preferred dividends.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN -3%) slips after Raymond James cut the shares to Market Perform following a switch...

    Ciena (CIEN -3%) slips after Raymond James cut the shares to Market Perform following a switch in analyst coverage earlier today. The new analyst downgraded the shares based a slow down in optical systems growth and margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • MDC

    MDC Holdings (MDC -3%) slips after being downgraded to Underweight on valuation at JPMorgan,...

    MDC Holdings (MDC -3%) slips after being downgraded to Underweight on valuation at JPMorgan, given its above average exposure to a new FHA rule that negatively impacts first time home buyers. The firm also lowers its price target to $20 from $22.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • HIMX

    Shares of Himax Technologies (HIMX +20.3%) soar after the Taiwanese semiconductor firm raises...

    Shares of Himax Technologies (HIMX +20.3%) soar after the Taiwanese semiconductor firm raises its Q1 guidance, citing strong sales in its display driver business, growth in all its product lines, and strength in the Chinese market. HIMX now sees a profit of $0.06 per ADS vs. its earlier forecast of $0.03-$0.04.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • SXC

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +3.7%) estimates its U.S. coke production jumped 25% to 1.1M tons in Q1,...

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +3.7%) estimates its U.S. coke production jumped 25% to 1.1M tons in Q1, drawing support from a new Ohio facility that achieved full capacity ahead of schedule. Continued production at that pace would put the company ahead of its target of 4M-4.2M tons for domestic coke production this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • BHC

    Medicis (MRX +2.5%) gains on positive comments out of Deutsche earlier this morning. Deutsche...

    Medicis (MRX +2.5%) gains on positive comments out of Deutsche earlier this morning. Deutsche says that after meeting with management, it believes its product pipeline is strong, an the launch of Zyclara shows a lot of promise. The firm ups its price target to $44 from $41 and reiterates its a Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.6%) and Penn National Gaming (PENN +0.9%) are the most likely gaming...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.6%) and Penn National Gaming (PENN +0.9%) are the most likely gaming stocks to beat Q1 expectations, Morgan Stanley predicts. LVS likely will outperform because of its Macau results, particularly its share gains in the VIP market, while Penn posted strong same-store gaming revenues for February, with sales rising 5% vs. 1% expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • AA

    Earnings season leadoff hitter Alcoa (AA -1.9%) looks set to strike out, according to analysts....

    Earnings season leadoff hitter Alcoa (AA -1.9%) looks set to strike out, according to analysts. The company is forecast to record its second consecutive quarterly loss on low aluminum prices when it reports next week with the only wildcard in the mix appearing to be the foreign currency translation to its bottom line. (Previous: RBC Capital on AA)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • MON

    Deutsche Bank defends Monsanto (MON -2.1%), saying its Q2 results indicate a strong start to the...

    Deutsche Bank defends Monsanto (MON -2.1%), saying its Q2 results indicate a strong start to the U.S. planting season. With corn acreage tracking to the high end of the target range, the firm ups estimates, raises its price target to $90 from $85 and reiterates its Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) decides to list its shares on the Nasdaq as the exchange claims another...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) decides to list its shares on the Nasdaq as the exchange claims another tech darling away from the NYSE. The IPO is expected to go off as early as next month - slated to be the largest offering since Google in 2004. NDAQ +1.1%, moving higher off the news reported by the NYT.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • CKEC

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Carmike Cinemas (CKEC -5.5%), saying that its secondary offering...

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Carmike Cinemas (CKEC -5.5%), saying that its secondary offering provides flexibility and will enable the company to grow and invest in its business. The firm also raises its target to $15 from $14 after the company pre-announced higher than expected Q1 admissions revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN +6.1%) rallies after Wells Fargo notes French regulators gave a favorable rating...

    InterMune (ITMN +6.1%) rallies after Wells Fargo notes French regulators gave a favorable rating to the company's Esbriet lung disease drug. Wells believes the rating should allow InterMune to "negotiate premium pricing" for Esbriet. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +1.8%) moves higher after Stifel Nicolaus says the driller's multiple is...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +1.8%) moves higher after Stifel Nicolaus says the driller's multiple is poised to increase and reiterates a buy on the stock. The firm sees production gaining by double digit levels over the next 15 years, with oil expected to comprise almost all of its reserves.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • MSFT

    Jim Cramer gives some love to Microsoft (MSFT +1.1%), noting on last night's Mad Money that the...

    Jim Cramer gives some love to Microsoft (MSFT +1.1%), noting on last night's Mad Money that the stock is a buy in front of a product refresh and both Windows 8 and the next-generation Xbox are slated to debut over the next year. MSFT's cozy 2.54% yield also catches the eye. (video)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    J.P. Morgan’s cuts its price target on shares of First Solar (FSLR -3.3%) to $20 from $35...

    J.P. Morgan’s cuts its price target on shares of First Solar (FSLR -3.3%) to $20 from $35 and withdraws its target for SunPower (SPWR -2.2%), writing that the global subsidies for solar power “show no signs of stabilization,” resulting in uncertain pricing for solar power modules. In the case of FSLR, -38% YTD, the call seems too little too late.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • PLCM

    UBS is defending Polycom (PLCM -16%) this morning, saying that the shares are on sale at current...

    UBS is defending Polycom (PLCM -16%) this morning, saying that the shares are on sale at current levels. The firm says the company is a leader in the UC Communications space, noting that demand is bottoming and it continues to be a potential acquisition target.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • MERU

    Meru Networks (MERU -13.5%) makes new lows after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $19M-$19.5M...

    Meru Networks (MERU -13.5%) makes new lows after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $19M-$19.5M (consensus is for $21.9M), and blaming the shortfall on sales, product, and CEO transition issues. Shares are down 76% from a 2010 IPO price of $15. Auriga thinks larger enterprise Wi-Fi rival Aruba Networks (ARUN +0.6%) has nothing to worry about, given Meru's issues are company-specific.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC -10%) shares are slammed after Raymond James cuts its rating to Market Perform...

    InterOil (IOC -10%) shares are slammed after Raymond James cuts its rating to Market Perform from Outperform, citing Papua New Guinea's six-month postponement of its general election. The move is a major setback, given IOC's prior insistence that the election would be a catalyst for getting LNG project approval from the government.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • APPCQ

    American Apparel (APP +8.8%) jumps after announcing late yesterday that preliminary comp store...

    American Apparel (APP +8.8%) jumps after announcing late yesterday that preliminary comp store sales for Q1 jumped 21%. Total net sales were up 15% Y/Y, easily topping expectations across all distribution channels, and adding momentum to the casual-clothing retailer's aggressive turnaround efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +8.4%) makes new all-time highs after beating FQ4 estimates on the...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +8.4%) makes new all-time highs after beating FQ4 estimates on the back of strong same-store sales, and offering in-line guidance. Jefferies (Buy) sees the results as proof the retailer will thrive as home furnishings sales "migrate into the direct channel," and expects e-commerce initiatives to "reduce concern that the company is standing still." Wedbush (Buy) praises BBBY's financials, product line, and cross-selling opportunities. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • STX

    Shares of Seagate Technology (STX -7.6%) and Western Digital (WDC -4.2%) sink following cautious...

    Shares of Seagate Technology (STX -7.6%) and Western Digital (WDC -4.2%) sink following cautious comments at FBN Securities, which lowers its target price on STX to $35 from $40 and WDC to $50 from $55 due to lower near-term supply HDD TAM assumptions and more aggressive pricing assumptions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • VEON

    Talks have soured between Vimpelcom (VIP -1.2%) and Algeria over the future of the Djezzy mobile...

    Talks have soured between Vimpelcom (VIP -1.2%) and Algeria over the future of the Djezzy mobile telecom business after Algeria fined Djezzy's boss $1.25B, Reuters reports. The two sides had been close to concluding a deal under which the Algerian state would have acquired from VIP a 51% stake in Algeria-based Djezzy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • AONEQ

    Shares of A123 Systems (AONE +29.3%) soar as AllianceBernstein discloses a 10.1% stake in the...

    Shares of A123 Systems (AONE +29.3%) soar as AllianceBernstein discloses a 10.1% stake in the lithium ion battery maker via an amended 13G filing, up from a previously reported 6.4%. Shares had been cut in half after last month's battery recall and resulting analyst downgrades.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • UAA

    Cowen initiates coverage on Under Armour (UA +0.7%) with an Outperform rating, just a day after...

    Cowen initiates coverage on Under Armour (UA +0.7%) with an Outperform rating, just a day after Stifel downgraded shares to Hold. The coverage universe on UA is relatively mixed with 10 Buys/Overweights on the books, offset by 16 Holds and 2 Sell/Overweight ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • CVX

    It's another stomach-churning dive in natural gas prices as EIA data shows a larger than...

    It's another stomach-churning dive in natural gas prices as EIA data shows a larger than expected inventory build (42 bcf vs. 34 bcf). May futures -2% to $2.095. UNG -1.4%. A natural gas producer ETF, however, is in the green, FCG +0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • ALVR

    Shares of microcap wireless communications provider Alvarion (ALVR -24%) sink after the company...

    Shares of microcap wireless communications provider Alvarion (ALVR -24%) sink after the company lowered Q1 guidance this morning. The cut is largely due to weak sales in one of its older product lines - to be replaced later this year - as well as delays in a large order that was set aside to next quarter. It now sees Q1 revenues of around $33M - $33.5M, below Street expectations of $40M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -17.8%) is trading near its 52-week low following its Q1 warning, which it...

    Polycom (PLCM -17.8%) is trading near its 52-week low following its Q1 warning, which it attributes to weak sales in North America and Asia-Pac, and which has triggered a downgrade to Market Perform from BMO. The warning is likely raising fears of additional share loss to Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) in the videoconferencing hardware market; IDC believes Cisco's Q4 videoconferencing sales strongly outpaced Polycom's.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • CXW

    Corrections Corp. of America (CXW +5.1%) shares spike as Corvex Management discloses a 7.04%...

    Corrections Corp. of America (CXW +5.1%) shares spike as Corvex Management discloses a 7.04% stake via a 13D filing, which says it has held discussions with CXW management including discussions of "options for enhancing shareholder value through various strategic alternatives."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • PAY

    VeriFone Systems (PAY +3.7%) pokes out a gain after catching an upgrade from Goldman Sachs to...

    VeriFone Systems (PAY +3.7%) pokes out a gain after catching an upgrade from Goldman Sachs to Buy from Neutral along with an improved price target of $63. The firm sees VeriFone benefiting from the multi-year terminal upgrade cycle set to hit due to emerging payment technology advances. Shares +46% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • KMX

    CarMax (KMX -2.8%) trades lower after it beat earnings estimates with its Q4 report by a penny,...

    CarMax (KMX -2.8%) trades lower after it beat earnings estimates with its Q4 report by a penny, but adjusted 2011 and 2012 statements by two cents to account for sale-leasebacks. In order to stay on its long-term growth trajectory, the firm plans to open 10 stores in FY13 and between 10-15 stores per year in FY14-FY16.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • SAP

    SAP (SAP -1.7%) gives back some of its 2012 gains after it's learned North American chief Robert...

    SAP (SAP -1.7%) gives back some of its 2012 gains after it's learned North American chief Robert Courteau has left the company 15 months after being appointed to the position. SAP's U.S. sales accounted for 26% of its total revenue last year, and rose 14% Y/Y. Nomura (Buy) says it isn't worried.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +4.8%) trades higher after catching an upgrade from Benchmark to Buy...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +4.8%) trades higher after catching an upgrade from Benchmark to Buy from Hold with an improved price target of $57. The firm raises its FY12-FY14 earnings estimates for the auction marketplace on the strength of expected market expansion. Shares of LQDT shot past their 52-week high in early trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE -14.4%) says it plans to offer 8.5M shares of its common stock at...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE -14.4%) says it plans to offer 8.5M shares of its common stock at $1.50/share. The developer of cancer treatments says it wants to use the proceeds for working capital and other general corporate needs, including clinical trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • SHLM

    Shares of A. Schulman (SHLM -10.3%) fall sharply after the firm misses earnings estimates with...

    Shares of A. Schulman (SHLM -10.3%) fall sharply after the firm misses earnings estimates with its FQ2 report as weak sales from Europe were too much to overcome.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • PPG

    PPG Industries (PPG +4.5%) issues upside guidance for Q1, seeing EPS of $1.75-$1.80,...

    PPGIndustries (PPG +4.5%) issues upside guidance for Q1, seeing EPS of $1.75-$1.80, excluding non-recurring items, vs. $1.44 consensus. PPG plans to book restructuring charges of $164M, or $1.06/share, which will impact ~2,000 employees. Business conditions were strong in North America and "solid" in Asia and other emerging regions.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • CKEC

    Movie theater company Carmike Cinemas (NASDAQ:CKEC) -10.3% premarket after announcing a...

    Movie theater company Carmike Cinemas (NASDAQ:CKEC) -10.3% premarket after announcing a secondary offering of 4M shares at $13/share, looking to raise funds for general corporate needs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • PTC

    Parametric Technology (PMTC) -16.2% premarket after the software developer lowers its Q2...

    Parametric Technology (PMTC) -16.2% premarket after the software developer lowers its Q2 forecast. PMTC says license revenue was impacted by a large transaction in Europe that did not close and lower than expected results in North America. It now expects Q2 EPS of $0.26-$0.28 on revenue of $300M, down from earlier guidance of $0.32-$0.36 and $305M-$320M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Market preview: Stocks are poised to extend yesterday's losses as rising Spanish and Italian...

    Market preview: Stocks are poised to extend yesterday's losses as rising Spanish and Italian bond yields again weigh on sentiment and overshadow more positive U.S. jobs data (I, II), with S&P benchmark futures -0.3%. Polycom tanks 20.2% following a profit warning, although Bed Bath & Beyond is +4.7% after Q4 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • WOLF

    Great Wolf Resorts (NASDAQ:WOLF) +12.3% premarket after saying it has received a $6.25/share...

    Great Wolf Resorts (NASDAQ:WOLF) +12.3% premarket after saying it has received a $6.25/share buyout offer from KSL Capital Partners, topping an earlier $5/share proposal from Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO). The new offer is a 9.6% premium to yesterday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • LLEN

    Shares of L&L Energy (NASDAQ:LLEN) shoot up 15.1% premarket after the company signs a major...

    Shares of L&L Energy (NASDAQ:LLEN) shoot up 15.1% premarket after the company signs a major agreement to provide coal to a large state-owned utility in China through one of its subsidiaries.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • KSS

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) same-store sales: +3.6% beats consensus of +2.1%. Shares -1.7% premarket. (PR)

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) same-store sales: +3.6% beats consensus of +2.1%. Shares -1.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • ALTH

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) roars to a 27.9% gain premarket up to $1.85 a share after...

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) roars to a 27.9% gain premarket up to $1.85 a share after Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) agrees to buy the company. The trading price falls in the range between the offering price of $1.82/share and the $1.93-a-share value of the deal with kickers. Shares of SPPI -9.9% premarket, reeling from a negative results from a trial on apaziquone.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • TJX

    TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) same-store sales: +10.0% beats consensus of +5.3%. Shares +2.1%...

    TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) same-store sales: +10.0% beats consensus of +5.3%. Shares +2.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • PRXI

    Premier Exhibitions (OTC:PRXI) +10% premarket after extending the deadline for submission of...

    Premier Exhibitions (OTC:PRXI) +10% premarket after extending the deadline for submission of bids for its artifact collection from the Titanic to April 9 due to the high level of interest in its auction.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharma (NASDAQ:SPPI) shares are hammered in premarket trading after the company's...

    Spectrum Pharma (NASDAQ:SPPI) shares are hammered in premarket trading after the company's experimental bladder cancer drug apaziquone failed to meet goals in two late-stage trials for non-muscle invasive bladder tumors. The announcement was separate from news of its acquisition of Allos Therapeutics. SPPI -10.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • GPS

    Gap (NYSE:GPS) same-store sales: +8% beats consensus of +5.4%. Shares +2.6% premarket. (PR)

    Gap (NYSE:GPS) same-store sales: +8% beats consensus of +5.4%. Shares +2.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) same-store sales: +7.3% beats consensus of +5.4%. Shares +1.1% premarket. (PR)

    Target (NYSE:TGT) same-store sales: +7.3% beats consensus of +5.4%. Shares +1.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • NTRI

    NutriSystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) decides that it will not renew the employment contract of CEO Joe...

    NutriSystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) decides that it will not renew the employment contract of CEO Joe Redling when it expires at the end of September. Shares -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • BKE

    Buckle (NYSE:BKE) same-store sales: +6.4% misses consensus of +8.8%. Shares -4.2% premarket. (PR)

    Buckle (NYSE:BKE) same-store sales: +6.4% misses consensus of +8.8%. Shares -4.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ): Q4 EPS of $0.69 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.38....

    Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ): Q4 EPS of $0.69 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.38. Revenue of $628M (-12.2% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -6.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • PLCM

    Shares of Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) tumble 14.1% premarket after the firm warns that Q1 revenue will...

    Shares of Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) tumble 14.1% premarket after the firm warns that Q1 revenue will be $364M-$370M, below the consensus estimate of analysts of $400.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 AM
  • CNK

    S&P announces that Cinemark (NYSE:CNK) will replace Nstar (NYSE:NST) in the S&P MidCap 400 Index...

    S&P announces that Cinemark (NYSE:CNK) will replace Nstar (NYSE:NST) in the S&P MidCap 400 Index after the close of trading on April 9. Shares of CNK +3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 AM
  • VOD

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) says it bought 12.5M of its own shares yesterday on the London Stock...

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) says it bought 12.5M of its own shares yesterday on the London Stock Exchange, and plans to hold the shares in treasury. Shares -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 AM | 2 Comments
